intro: Asperula szovitsii, commonly known as Szovits' evergreen azalea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of western China, particularly in Sichuan and Yunnan provinces. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant, pink to reddish-purple flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soil and requires partial shade to full sun. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in horticulture.
